historical:
Prior Codifications

2001 Ed., § 51-102.01

Legislative History of Laws

Law 5-3, the "District of Columbia Unemployment Compensation Act of 1983," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-57, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 1, 1983. Signed by the Mayor on March 15, 1983, it was assigned Act No. 5-13 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

Miscellaneous Notes

Expiration of Law 5-3: Section 4 of D.C. Law 5-3, as amended by § 4 of D.C. Law 5-124, provided that except for provisions of § 2(a), (b), (d), (f)(2), (g), (h), (j), (1)(3), (m), (n), (o), (p), (q), (r), and (s) of D.C. Law 5-3, D.C. Law 5-3 shall expire on December 31, 1985.

Section 46-102.1 [1981 Ed.], which derived from § 3 of D.C. Law 5-3, expired December 31, 1985.

DC CODE § 51-152

Current through December 11, 2012

heading.catch_text: Unemployment Compensation Study Commission on the Solvency of the District Unemployment Fund. [Expired]
